text: ID: 515	TITLE: Feet First	GENRE: Comedy	PLOT: Ambitious shoe ________, ______, unknowingly meets the ____' daughter and tells her he is a leather tycoon. The rest of the film he spends hiding his true circumstances, in the store and later on a ship. Trying to deliver a letter, he later finds himself dangling high above the street on a building's scaffolding.

ID: 516	TITLE: The Florodora Girl	GENRE: Drama, Musical, Romance	PLOT: A chorus girl gets bad advice from her fellow chorines in handling a rich suitor who assumes she is a gold-digger. But she assumes he is after "one thing" and is holding out for marriage. After meeting his mother, she learns that her beau is engaged to a society girl. He loses his money and they drift apart. But after making a new fortune, he comes to the theater.

ID: 517	TITLE: Easy Come, Easy Go	GENRE: Adventure, Comedy, Music	PLOT: Navy frogman, ___________ (_____________), balances his time between twin careers as a deep sea diver and nightclub ______. During a dive, ___ spots sunken treasure and returns with hope to retrieve it.

ID: 518	TITLE: Free and Easy	GENRE: Comedy, Musical	PLOT: __________________ hosts a beauty contest. The winner, _______________, and her mother go to _________. The Chamber of ________ also provides ______ with an agent, ___________'s own _____ _______. _____ likes ______ and the shy ______ likes him, but Mrs. ________, a formidable woman, has little use for hapless _____. On the train west, they meet movie star ______________, who takes a shine to ______ and helps her meet MGM directors once they get to ___________. _____, meanwhile, wants to help ______ with her career and he also wants to be her man. Movie stardom does come to _________________________, but to whom is a surprise. And who will win the lovely ______'s hand?

ID: 519	TITLE: The Girl Said No	GENRE: Comedy, Romance	PLOT: ________ is just back from _______ and the only thing that he seemed to learn is how to be obnoxious and loud. He forgoes a bank job to work at ______ and Company just to make time with ____, McAndrews' fiancée. ____ warms to ___, but his work is such that his job is history. After losing his father, it is up to ___ to support and care for his family. His attitude towards work changes, but not his attitude towards ____.

ID: 520	TITLE: Hell's Angels	GENRE: Drama, War	PLOT: Two brothers attending ______ enlist with the RAF when World War I breaks out. ___ and ______________ have very different personalities. _____ is a freewheeling womanizer, even with his brother's girlfriend _____. He also proves to have a yellow streak when it comes to his Night Patrol duties. ___ is made of strong moral fiber and attempts to keep his brother in line. Both volunteer for an extremely risky two man bombing mission for different reasons. _____ wants to lose his cowardly reputation and ___ seeks to protect his brother. Their assignment to knock out a strategic German munitions facility is a booming success, but with a squadron of fighters bearing down on them afterwards, escape seems unlikely.

ID: 521	TITLE: Hog Wild	GENRE: Short, Comedy	PLOT: Mrs. _____ insists that ______ mount the radio aerial on the roof before he goes off gallivanting with his friend _______. But with _______'s assistance, ______ spends more time falling off the roof than atop it. Making one last attempt, ______ climbs to the top of a ladder he's mounted on his Model T Ford, but just then _______ accidentally starts the car. A wild ride through the streets of ___________ culminates in an unscheduled streetcar stop.

ID: 522	TITLE: Just Imagine	GENRE: Comedy, Fantasy, Musical, Romance, Sci-Fi	PLOT: ________, 1980: airplanes have replaced cars, numbers have replaced names, pills have replaced food, government-arranged marriages have replaced love, and test tube babies have replaced ... well, you get the idea. Scientists revive a man struck by lightning in 1930; he is rechristened "Single O". He is befriended by J-21, who can't marry the girl of his dreams because he isn't "distinguished" enough -- until he is chosen for a 4-month expedition to Mars by a __________________. The Mars J-21, his friend, and stowaway Single O visit is full of scantily clad women doing ______________-style dance numbers and worshiping a fat middle-aged man.

ID: 523	TITLE: King of Jazz	GENRE: Animation, Music	PLOT: This revue presents its numbers around the orchestra leader _____________, besides that it shows in it's final number that the European popular music are the roots of American popular music, called Jazz.

ID: 524	TITLE: Ladies of Leisure	GENRE: Drama, Romance	PLOT: ____________ is the son of a rich ___________, but wants to be a _______. He hires Kay Arnold, a good girl with a bad past, as a model. They fall in love, and plan to get married. But _____'s parents raise strong objections.

ID: 525	TITLE: The Laurel-Hardy Murder Case	GENRE: Short, Comedy, Crime, Mystery	PLOT: It looks like the boys won't need to fish off the end of the pier to feed themselves any longer when _______'s rich uncle _______________ dies, leaving a large estate. But when he and ______ arrive for the reading of the will, they learn that ________ was murdered, and that ____, along with all the other relatives, is a prime suspect.

ID: 526	TITLE: Little Caesar	GENRE: Action, Crime, Drama, Romance	PLOT: ____ is a small-time hood who knocks off gas stations for whatever he can take. He heads east and signs up with ___________'s mob. A New Year's Eve robbery at __________________'s casino results in the death of the new crime commissioner _____________. Rico's good friend ___________, who works at the club as a professional ______, works as the gang's lookout man and wants out of the gang. ____ is ambitious and eventually takes over Vettori's gang; he then moves up to the next echelon pushing out Diamond ____________. When he orders ___ to dump his girlfriend ____ and re-join the gang, ____ decides there's only one way out for them.

ID: 527	TITLE: Madam Satan	GENRE: Musical, Romance, Comedy	PLOT: ______ and __________ are an upper class couple. Unfortunately, ___ is an unfaithful husband. But ______ has a plan to win back her husband's affections. An elaborate masquerade ball is to be held aboard a magnificent dirigible. ______ will attend and disguise herself as a mysterious devil woman. Hidden behind her mask, and wrapped in an alluring gown, ______ as the devil woman will to try to seduce her unknowing husband and teach him a lesson.

ID: 528	TITLE: Min and Bill	GENRE: Comedy, Drama	PLOT: Min owns the waterfront hotel where ____, the _______ of a fishing boat, lives. Also living and working in the hotel is _____, whom ___ took in some years ago as an abandoned girl. Now that _____ is older, the truant officer and the police think that she should be moved to a different environment, and Min is torn between her attachment to _____ and her concern that the waterfront may not be the best place for a young woman. Matters are brought to a head by the sudden re-appearance of _____, _____'s disreputable mother.

ID: 529	TITLE: Monte Carlo	GENRE: Adventure, Comedy, Family, Romance	PLOT: A young woman, her uptight step sister and her best friend use their savings for a long anticipated dream trip to _____, which turns out to be a big disappointment. When they decide to take a break from their lousy tour and duck into the lobby of a luxury hotel, one of them is mistaken for a spoiled British heiress. Before they get the chance to reveal their true identities they are wrapped up in misadventures during a vacation to ___________ instead.

ID: 530	TITLE: Morocco	GENRE: Drama, Romance	PLOT: The Foreign Legion marches in to _______ with booze and women in mind just as ______ _________ arrives from _____ to work at Lo Tinto's cabaret. That night, insouciant legionnaire _________ catches her inimitably seductive, tuxedo-clad act. Both bruised by their past lives, the two edge cautiously into a no-strings relationship while being pursued by others. But ___ must leave on a perilous mission: is it too late for them?

ID: 531	TITLE: Night Owls	GENRE: Comedy, Drama	PLOT: After workaholic _____ has a drunken one night stand with the beautiful train-wreck ________, he's horrified to discover that she's actually his boss' jilted ex-mistress. When she takes a bottle of sleeping pills, _____ is forced to keep her awake... and over the course of the night the two begin to fall for each other.

ID: 532	TITLE: Our Blushing Brides	GENRE: Drama	PLOT: Three department store girls--______, ______, and _____--share an apartment on West 91st Street in _____________. Each earns little more than 20 dollars per week. _____ is the sensible one, but the others throw themselves at amoral rich men in an attempt to hook one and better themselves. They end up being hurt and disappointed despite _____'s attempts to warn them.

ID: 533	TITLE: Within the Law	GENRE: Crime, Drama, Romance	PLOT: ___________, is wrongly accused, by her employer _____________, and then convicted of theft. In prison she studies law books, and on release partners with another woman to legally scam wealthy men, including ___________, son of her accuser.

ID: 534	TITLE: Paid	GENRE: Drama, Film-Noir	PLOT: ___________ goes up for three years on a crime she didn't commit. Once out she and former prison mates plan a scam in which old men can be sued for breach of promise - the "heart balm" racket. After plotting verious ways to get back at the men who set her up initially, she softens and settles down.

ID: 535	TITLE: Raffles	GENRE: Adventure, Comedy, Crime, Drama, History, Romance, Thriller	PLOT: Man about town and First Class cricketer ____________ keeps himself solvent with daring robberies. Meeting ____ from his schooldays and falling in love all over again, he spends the weekend with her parents, Lord and Lady _______. A necklace presents an irresistible temptation, but also in attendance is Scotland Yard's finest, finally on the trail.

ID: 536	TITLE: Remote Control	GENRE: Comedy, Crime	PLOT: Since his mother wants to watch TV, ____, a young auto-mechanic, must recover her remote control, accidentally taken by his punk sister ____. During his quest, he becomes involved in the conflict between ____, the liquor smuggler, and ____, a night club owner who wants to be Iceland's first mafia boss.

ID: 537	TITLE: The Story of the Fox	GENRE: Animation, Comedy, Family	PLOT: In the kingdom of animals, __________ is used to trick and fool everyone. So ________, the Lion, receives more and more complaints about him. He orders that __________ is arrested and ...

ID: 538	TITLE: Romance	GENRE: Drama	PLOT: Although deeply in love with her boyfriend - and indeed sleeping in the same bed with him - a schoolteacher cannot handle the almost complete lack of intimacy he will allow. Increasingly frustrated, she gradually finds her sexual appetites leading her into ever more risky situations, including a developing one with the headmaster.

ID: 539	TITLE: The Blood of a Poet	GENRE: Fantasy	PLOT: A young ______ draws a face at a canvas on his easel. Suddenly the mouth on the drawing comes into life and starts talking. The ______ tries to wipe it away with his hand, but when he looks into the hand he finds the living mouth on his palm. He tries to wipe it off on the mouth of an unfinished statue of a young woman. The statue comes into life and tells him that the only way out of the studio is through the looking glass. The ______ jumps into the mirror and comes to the Hotel of Dramatic Lunacies. He peeps through the keyholes of a series of hotel rooms. In the last room he sees desperate meetings of hermaphrodites. One of them has a signboard saying "Mortal danger". Back in the studio the ______ crushes the statue with a sledgehammer. Because of this he himself becomes a statue, located at the side of a square. Some schoolboys start a snowball fight around the statue. One of the boys is killed by a snowball. A fashionable couple start playing cards at a table beside the corpse. The woman tells the man that unless he holds the ace of hearts he is doomed. The man takes the ace of hearts from the dead boy. The child's guardian, a black angel, appears and takes away the corpse as well as the card. Losing the ace of hearts the man shoots himself. The woman is transformed into the unfinished statue from the studio, and walks away.

ID: 540	TITLE: Up the River	GENRE: Comedy, Crime, Drama	PLOT: Two prisoners, ___________ and _____________, escape during a theatrical production in order to go to the aid of _____, a former ________ whose past is about to be exposed by the man who framed ____ unless _____ agrees to help him commit another crime.

ID: 541	TITLE: Way Out West	GENRE: Comedy, Family, Western	PLOT: ____ and _____ are charged with delivering the deed to a valuable gold mine to the daughter of a dead __________. However they reckon without the machinations of her evil guardian ______ Finn who is determined to have the gold mine for himself and his saloon ______ wife ____.

ID: 542	TITLE: Way for a Sailor	GENRE: Romance, Drama	PLOT: ____ is a sailor who lives to go to sea. A typical sailor, he is always broke and has been in seven jails in the last seven ports. The one girl he tries to impress the most is in ______ and his mates call her 'the Eskimo'. For two years, he approaches her every time he docks near ______, and for two years, ____ rejects the expensive gifts he brings to her and ignores any and all advances he makes. She wants nothing to do with a sailor. When ____ uses trickery to convince ____ to marry him, ____ leaves him when she finds out the truth about his so called new life. There are rough seas ahead as ____ tries to get Joan to come back to him.

ID: 543	TITLE: Westfront 1918	GENRE: Drama, Romance, War	PLOT: A group of German infantrymen of the First World War live out their lives in the trenches of ______. They find brief entertainment and relief in a village behind the lines, but primarily terror fills their lives as the attacks on and from the French army ebb and flow. One of the men, ____, goes home on leave only to discover the degradation forced on his family by wartime poverty. He returns to the lines in time to face an enormous attack by French tanks.

ID: 544	TITLE: Whoopee!	GENRE: Comedy, Musical, Romance	PLOT: Western _______ _________ is preparing to marry ____________; she loves part-Indian _______, whose race is an obstacle. _____ flees the wedding with hypochondriac ______________, who thinks he's just giving her a ride; but she left a note saying they've eloped! Chasing them are jilted ___, _____'s nurse ____ (who's been trying to seduce him) and others.

ID: 545	TITLE: The Golden Age	GENRE: Short, Comedy	PLOT: In a re-imagining of the odd couple, we follow ______ and ______ as they travel to _______ for George's college reunion. Once there, chaos ensues as ______ attempts to woo a past love.

ID: 546	TITLE: L'Age d'Or	GENRE: Comedy, Drama	PLOT: Bunuel's first feature has more of a plot than Un _____________ (1929), but it's still a pure Surrealist film, so this is only a vague outline. A man and a woman are passionately in love with one another, but their attempts to consummate that passion are constantly thwarted, by their families, the Church and bourgeois society.

ID: 547	TITLE: An American Tragedy	GENRE: Crime, Drama, Romance	PLOT: Having just reached adulthood, _______________ has always lamented his lot in life, he the only son of poor missionaries. He has gotten a peripheral view of society life, to which he aspires, in his work as a bellhop at an upscale hotel. If being truthful to himself, he would admit that he lacks moral strength, he often taking the easiest but perhaps not the most ethical path to protect himself. Forced to move from place to place out of circumstance, he ends up in ________, New York working at the Samuel Griffiths Collar and Shirt factory, ________________ his paternal uncle. Not knowing his uncle or his family, _____ only wants a chance to get ahead, not expecting anything else from his wealthy relations. After an apprenticeship, _____ ends up as the _______ in the stamping department. Despite a company rule forbidding foremen to fraternize with staff, especially those working in the same department, _____ begins an affair, a clandestine one out of necessity, with _____________, who works in the stamping department under him. Their love is an obsessive one, made all the more powerful due to its clandestine nature. That changes for _____ when he meets, through his wealthy relations, society maiden _______________, the two who immediately fall in love with each other. The extra draw of ______ over ____ is Sondra's standing in society. By this time, ____ informs him that she is pregnant with his child, she pressuring him to do right by her in getting married. Wanting to be with ______ instead, _____ contemplates murdering ____ by drowning her in a lake, he knowing that she doesn't know how to swim. Although _____ is ultimately unable to commit this act of murder and will do right in marrying ____, he, due to that lack of moral strength, nonetheless is caught in a resulting tragic situation for all involved.

ID: 548	TITLE: The Bachelor Father	GENRE: Comedy, Drama, Romance	PLOT: Lonely in his English country estate, Sir _____ decides to gather his grown (albeit illegitimate) children around him in his declining years. He uses a ledger which keeps track of the payments he has been making to ex-lovers to locate 2 of them, and a third is found by a ______ in ________, her mother was too proud to accept any money. Sir _____ is a curmudgeon, and his three adult children have a hard time with him at first. ____, the American, is a free spirit who had a budding career in show business. _______ is English and a semi-gentleman, and _____ is Italian, with a Latin temperament. They begin to bond, especially Sir _____ and ____, whose outgoing personality finally wins over the old man. But past lives begin to creep back into the picture and threaten the old man's plans for a life filled with his children.

ID: 549	TITLE: Bad Girl	GENRE: Drama, Romance	PLOT: A mug and a jane: _______ knows that every guy is going to make a pass at her; _____ knows that every gal wastes her money on good times. He's saving to open a repair shop. When the two of them meet, they can't believe they get along. One evening he leaves her waiting in the rain; she finds his apartment and reads him the riot act. They end up spooning and napping until 4 AM. She's afraid of her brother, who's her guardian, so _____ figures she should tell her brother that she's getting married the next morning. _______ tries out the story but knows _____ won't show up. It's the first of a series of promises, fears, miscalculations, and hard knocks. Where will they end up?

ID: 550	TITLE: The Bad Sister	GENRE: Drama	PLOT: ________ falls in love with con man _________ who uses their relation to get her father's endorsement on a money-raising scheme. He runs off with the money and ________, later dumping her. Her sister _____ loves Dr. _______ although she knows he loves ________. ________ returns and marries a wealthy young man, and _______ turns his love toward _____.

ID: 551	TITLE: Gambling Daughters	GENRE: Mystery	PLOT: While trailing the school French teacher, Professor Bedoin, hoping to catch him in a romantic interlude, _______________ and __________________, students at the exclusive Lakeside School for Girls, follow him to _____________, a gambling joint and learn that he is a regular ______ there. _____________, the _______ and henchman of a mysterious and unseen owner, induces the girls to play on credit. Lillian, the younger of the two, falls in love with ______, and over a period of days, writes him several passionate love letters. When the girls have lost several thousand dollars at the crooked roulette wheels, ______ uses the letters as a club to make the girls steal valuable family jewels to make good their losses. The thefts bring insurance investigator Jimmy ______ to the school posing as a gym instructor. He stumbles upon a clue which makes _________ confess her part in the crimes, and with this to work on, he sets out to trap the club's ring leader.

ID: 552	TITLE: Be Big!	GENRE: Short, Comedy	PLOT: On their way to the train station with their wives for a vacation in _____________, _______ and ______ get a phone call from a fellow lodge member who tells them a surprise stag party in their honor is being held that evening. ______ feigns illness to get out of the trip, and the wives head off to the train station by themselves. _______'s attempts to help ______ get into his lodge uniform turn into a series of disasters. Meanwhile, the wives miss the last train and, returning to discover the deception, come after their husbands with shotguns.

ID: 553	TITLE: Beau Hunks	GENRE: Short, Comedy	PLOT: Jilted by his girlfriend, "_____________," ______ joins the Foreign Legion to forget, bringing _______ along with him. They wilt under the scorching desert sun and under the harsh discipline of the Commandant. On a long march to reinforce remote _________, the boys get lost in the sands, finally reaching the Fort only to find it besieged by the fearsome Riffs.

ID: 554	TITLE: Bimbo's Initiation	GENRE: Animation, Short, Comedy, Family, Fantasy	PLOT: _____ finds himself surrounded by a mysterious group of robed figures who invite him to become a member of their secret organization. When he refuses, they fling him through a nightmarish sequence of terror and torture devices. Will our hapless hero make it out alive?

ID: 555	TITLE: The Black Camel	GENRE: Crime, Mystery, Thriller	PLOT: __________ ____________ is seeing wealthy ___________ while filming in ________, ______, but won't marry him without consulting famed psychic _________ first. _________ confronts her about the unsolved murder of fellow film star __________ three years earlier, and she decides to reject Jaynes' proposal. When ______ is found shot to death in her beach-front pavilion, _______ Chan of the Honolulu Police investigates.

ID: 556	TITLE: Blonde Crazy	GENRE: Comedy, Crime, Drama, Romance	PLOT: At a midwestern hotel, conniving bellhop Bert Harris has a finger in every pie. He promotes a job for glamorous ___________, but she does not immediately succumb to his charms. However, ____ soon enlists ___ as partner in his new profession of con man. Most of the victims they fleece are lawbreakers themselves. But ____ is tempted to try actual stealing, and ___ fears it will bring bad luck...

ID: 557	TITLE: The Champ	GENRE: Drama, Sport	PLOT: ___________, a former boxing champion, is now horse trainer in _______. He makes just enough money to raise his little boy ____, over whom he got custody after his wife _____ left him seven years ago. ____ worships The Champ who is now working on his come-back in order to give his boy a better future. But suddenly _____ shows up again ...

ID: 558	TITLE: Chickens Come Home-	GENRE: Short, Comedy	PLOT: _____ is running for mayor when an old flame (Mae Busch) tries to blackmail him with a old photo ('just the same old apple-cheeked boy'). Stan's attempts to help _____ keep the blackmailer at bay incur the wrath of the shrewish Mrs Laurel who takes her revenge with an axe.

ID: 559	TITLE: La Chienne	GENRE: Crime, Drama	PLOT: _______ _______________ is married to _____, a terror. By chance, he meets ________, "____", and makes her his mistress. He thinks he finally met love, but ____ is nothing but a streetwalker, in love with ____, her pimp. She only accepts Legrand to satisfy Dede's needs of money.

ID: 560	TITLE: Cimarron	GENRE: Drama, Western	PLOT: When the government opens up the Oklahoma territory for settlement, restless _____________ claims a plot of the free land for himself and moves his family there from _______. A newspaperman, ______, and just about everything else, ______ soon becomes a leading citizen of the boom town of Osage. Once the town is established, however, he begins to feel confined once again, and heads for the Cherokee Strip, leaving his family behind. During this and other absences, his wife _____ must learn to take care of herself and soon becomes prominent in her own right.

ID: 561	TITLE: City Lights	GENRE: Comedy, Drama, Romance	PLOT: A tramp falls in love with a beautiful blind girl. Her family is in financial trouble. The tramp's on-and-off friendship with a wealthy man allows him to be the girl's benefactor and suitor.

ID: 562	TITLE: City Streets	GENRE: Crime, Drama, Film-Noir, Romance	PLOT: ___, a racketeer's daughter, is in love with _______, a shooting gallery showman. Despite ___'s prodding, _______ has no ambitions about joining the rackets and making enough money to support ___ in the lifestyle she's accustomed to. Her attitude changes after her father implicates her in a murder and she's sent to prison. During her incarceration, her father convinces _______ to join the gang in order to help free ___. When ___ is released, she wants nothing more to do with the mob and tries to get The ___ to quit, but she may be too late.

ID: 563	TITLE: Come Clean	GENRE: Short, Comedy	PLOT: The ______, hoping to avoid having the Laurels drop in and spoil their quiet evening, pretend not to be home when the couple inevitably call. But their subterfuge is discovered, and to make the best of it, _______ and ______ go out to buy ice cream. On the way, they spot ____, a woman wanted by the police, jump in the river. They save her, only to have her blackmail them into supporting her, or else she'll claim they tried to kill her. Back home, troubles ensue when the boys try to keep their wives from learning what they've brought home instead of ice cream.

ID: 564	TITLE: The Criminal Code	GENRE: Crime, Drama, Romance	PLOT: A wily D.A.(Brady) gets a 10 year conviction of a young 20 year old (Robert Graham)who he knows killed a man in self defense. Years later _____ becomes warden of the prison holding ______. When _____ realizes that 6 years of working in the prison jute mill has pushed ______ to the breaking point, he gives him a chance- a new job as his valet. ______ responds well and earns the respect of both the warden and his beautiful daughter. Graham's mettle is put to the test when he stumbles onto a prison murder committed by his cell-mate. He must choose between the criminal code of silence and the warden's strong persuasion to reveal the killer.

ID: 565	TITLE: Dance, Fools, Dance	GENRE: Crime, Drama, Romance	PLOT: After her father ______________ loses his wealth in market, ______ goes to work as a cub ________. Her brother ______ is the wheel man in a gangland massacre. ____, a ________ on ______'s paper, is murdered while investigating. ______ gets to know gang leader _________ and learns how the gang works and that her brother is involved. By the time it's over her wealthy friend ___ sees how wonderful she is and falls in love with her for good.

ID: 566	TITLE: Just a Gigolo	GENRE: Comedy, Romance	PLOT: Haines plays the role of a festive British ________, for whom a marriage has been arranged by his relatives. He goes to a European Summer resort and poses as a gigolo to meet the girl chosen, learn what she's like and to apply the "acid test".

ID: 567	TITLE: Dirigible	GENRE: Adventure	PLOT: A French explorer enlists the help of the US Navy in an expedition to ______________. There is competition between the airship division and fixed wing fliers, resolved in triumph and disasters.

ID: 568	TITLE: Dracula	GENRE: Fantasy, Horror	PLOT: After a harrowing ride through the Carpathian mountains in eastern ______, ________ enters castle Dracula to finalize the transferral of Carfax Abbey in ______ to _____________, who is in actuality a vampire. ________ is drugged by the eerily hypnotic count, and turned into one of his thralls, protecting him during his sea voyage to ______. After sucking the blood and turning the young ___________ into a vampire, _______ turns his attention to her friend ___________, daughter of Dr. ______ who then calls in a specialist, Dr. ___________, to diagnose the sudden deterioration of Mina's health. ___________, realizing that Dracula is indeed a vampire, tries to prepare Mina's fiance, ___________, and Dr. ______ for what is to come and the measures that will have to be taken to prevent ____ from becoming one of the undead.

ID: 569	TITLE: Drácula	GENRE: Fantasy, Horror	PLOT: At midnight on Walpurgis Night, an English _____, ________, arrives at Count Dracula's castle in the ____________________. After signing papers to take over a ruined abbey near ______, _______ drives ________ mad and commands obedience. ________ escorts the boxed count on a death ship to ______. From there, the Count is introduced into the society of his neighbor, Dr. ______, who runs an asylum. _______ makes short work of family friend, ____________, then begins his assault on __________, the doctor's daughter. A visiting expert in the occult, ___________, recognizes Dracula for who he is, and there begins a battle for ___'s body and soul.

ID: 570	TITLE: The Beggar's Opera	GENRE: Crime, History, Musical	PLOT: Authentic rendering of ________'s 18th century musical, filmed in Technicolor, about Captain MacHeath, a highwayman, and his love for too many beautiful women. Betrayed by _____ and _____, two of his bygone lovers, and temporarily freed by two others, ________ is arrested and condemned to death. While waiting to be hanged, the _______ is entertained by a musical beggar, who has written an opera of which the highwayman is the hero.

ID: 571	TITLE: Five Star Final	GENRE: Crime, Drama	PLOT: Hinchcliffe, the ruthless publisher of a sleazy ________ tabloid, is concerned that the ethical journalistic policies of ___________________ have caused a drop in circulation. He pressures the newsman to run more sensational stories including resurrecting the twenty year old Vorhees Murder Case. Although the perpetrator's actions were ultimately judged justifiable, and she has been subsequently living an exemplary life in anonymity, ___________ insists _______ revisit the story. _______ assigns Isopod, an alcoholic degenerate, to dig up anything lurid that he find. The unprincipled reporter fraudulently insinuates himself into the Vorhees' home masquerading as a minister and gets the expose he sought. Yellow journalism triumphs, and a decent woman's name gets dragged through the mud again... with tragic consequences.

ID: 572	TITLE: Five and Ten	GENRE: Drama, Romance	PLOT: ____ owns the largest chain of five and ten cent stores in the country. He moves his family to ________ from ___________ and their life, though grand, is falling apart due to his constant working. Wife and mother _____ is lonely. Son _____ hates his job. Daughter ________ is snubbed by classmate ______ and her friends. At a charity bazaar, ________ meets _____ and sparks are evident. However, he is engaged to ______ and ______ will make sure that she, and only she, marries Berry. After the marriage, _____ still thinks of Jennifer as ________ thinks of Berry. _____ laments about the state of his family since they were happy in ___________.

ID: 573	TITLE: A Free Soul	GENRE: Crime, Drama, Romance	PLOT: ____________, an upper class alcoholic defense attourney, successfully defends local mobster Ace Wilfong in a murder case. After his daughter ________ breaks her engagement to polo player _______________ and starts an affair with _______, she finds that the liason is not easily severed when she wants out. ________ earns Miss ____'s true affections by killing _______ to break his grip on her. Now the question is, can Stephen ____ save ________ with an impassioned defense speech to the jury?

ID: 574	TITLE: The Front Page	GENRE: Comedy, Drama, Romance	PLOT: When _____________, the top ________ of a Chicago newspaper announces that he is quitting to get married, his editor, ____________ desperately tries to change his mind. When denial, cursing, and luring don't work, ______ resorts to tricks. It's the day before a supposed communist is to be hanged, and all _______ waits with baited breath. Meanwhile, each of the papers has a man on the story trying to get a scoop or angle for themselves. With a train to catch at midnight to join his fiancé, _____ is at first not interested, but events and his own habits work against him as the day unfolds, and he can't help but get roped in, especially when the man to be executed escapes and then almost literally falls into his lap.
